reviewText: All parents with a teen playing serious junior tennis needs to watch this. Very well made. Very true.

I've watched this over and over again since I first saw it my sophomore year in high school. More than 10 times. Such a great look into the junior tennis world. If you are a part of that world, you'll be impressed with the ground this covers both directly and indirectly. Content of this movie sticks with me to this day.
If you have kids playing the junior circuit, this is a must watch.

A tennis version of Hoop Dreams, a Sundance winning basketball documentary, Unstrung follows a group of junior tennis players including Sam Querrey and Donald Young, leading up to the US national junior championship in Kalamazoo. The film is captivating, it's sometimes heartbreaking and in the end, a fascinating study of a generation of American juniors.
This should be an Academy Award winner.

If your kid plays competitive tennis, don't miss this documentary.
It gives you an insight into the world of junior competitive tennis, rarely know to aspiring parents.

Features six or seven of the top Juniors in the country in 2005, including Donald Young and Sam Querrey.  Not sure if a casual tennis fan would fully get into this DVD, but if you follow the ATP and WTA tours year-round and are interested in how the Pros began their tennis odyssey, this is definitely a documentary you'll enjoy.
